data.title: Update AUTHORS
Adjust the minigames' lobby settings
data.body:
- Disabled messing around with `TechLevel` as you can't build on those maps or the prerequisites are defined by the map.
- Removed "hardcoded" `Enemies: xyz` as you can't define teams anymore (for e.g. a 2vs2). Exception: `fort-lonestar`
- Removed `LockSpawn: True` from `dropzone-w`. That way it's useless anyway (see #7704).
- Disabled bots in `the-hot-box`
- Disabled different teams in `fort-lonestar` and also forced the race to `allies`

data.title: RA - Actor type gnrl: Bogus yaml removals: ScaredyCat
data.body:
I was tring update my map to playtest. When i select bleed to check map Resource Center gives that error. Why i'm writing it there. Because it is defined infantry.yaml not my map's yaml file. It wasn't giving any error on older versions.

Map: http://resource.openra.net/maps/3470/

`-ScaredyCat` isn't there on my fork. Not sure which PR added this.

data.title: Palette colors 254-255 are whited out
data.body: Any color on the last 4 slots of the palette will be rendered as white, ignoring the color they have in the palette itself.

data.title: TD artillery doesn't explode at all anymore
data.body: #8303 disabled artillery's vehicle explosion completely, I think we shoul change that to the small unit explosion that all other vehicles use.

data.title: Make modchooser's loadscreen consistent
data.body: as described in #8592.

data.title: Sound engine should support streaming
data.body: Simply uncompressing AUD/IMA ADPCM into memory before playing them is not exactly efficient. In case of IMA 22khz/stereo (let alone 44khz/st) it can even cause a noticable lag spike when a large music file is loaded.

data.title: Clicking on an online game to join will launch OpenRA with the Directory.GetCurrentDirectory() returning the browser's directory
data.body: Causing a crash when switching mods for sure.

data.title: Crash during building placement and (last) MCV destroyed
data.body:
Happend during a muliplayer game (Red Alert - Latest Release).
It seemed to happen when I tried to place a building the moment my (only) MCV got destroyed.

http://pastebin.com/mBXN5Yt7

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20150614
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: De objectverwijzing is niet op een exemplaar van een object ingesteld.
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Orders.PlaceBuildingOrderGenerator..ctor(ProductionQueue queue, String name)
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ProductionPaletteWidget.PickUpCompletedBuildingIcon(ProductionIcon icon, ProductionItem item)
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ProductionPaletteWidget.HandleLeftClick(ProductionItem item, ProductionIcon icon, Boolean handleMultiple)
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ProductionPaletteWidget.HandleEvent(ProductionIcon icon, Boolean isLeftClick, Boolean handleMultiple)
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ProductionPaletteWidget.HandleMouseInput(MouseInput mi)
   bij OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleMouseInputOuter(MouseInput mi)
```

data.title: Objectives polish
Make range circles visible to observers
data.body: Closes #8543

data.title: Massive AI performance issues related to water units
data.body:
Not only does the AI run into problems when trying to build sub pens/ship yards when there's no water nearby (#8569), it actually gets even worse when it does manage to build a pen/yard and then tries to attack land enemies with water units (and vice versa). This causes huge lag spikes.

We should consider disabling naval buildings and ships for all RA AIs except the Naval AI, at least until those performance issues are fixed at code level. Currently, playing games with AI in the RA mod is a nightmare in terms of performance.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/23246105-massive-ai-performance-issues-related-to-water-units?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Music ends unexpectedly when pressing "Start Game" in the lobby
data.body: Introduced in #8568.

data.title: UpgradeManager after IUpgradables
data.body: Fixes #8444 as a consequence.

data.title: Check code for missing Requires<>
data.body:
If we managed to find and add all missing `Requires<>` throughout the code, the number of potential inheritance issues and crashes would go down.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/23241247-check-code-for-missing-requires?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixed potential AttackMove crash
Added a hide UI hotkey
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6779.

data.title: Enable the EMP overlay animation in TS.
data.body:
NB: This must use `WithDecoration` because `WithIdleOverlay` forces the Image be taken from the source actor, requiring it specified on every sequence - this is a more maintainable solution.

This is mostly aimed to @pchote after the discussion last night.

data.title: Add myself to the contributor list.
data.body: :smiley:

data.title: Added new map El Dorado for Tiberian Dawn
data.body: It is using the JUNGLE tileset which we have none shipped so far and the gameplay promises to focus a lot on quick expansion. I also really like the details like the crashed A10, church and the creeps defending the middle.

data.title: Satellite reveals some submerged subs
data.body:
Playing a 2v2 as soviet I could see some enemy subs after my teammate got the sattelite up. On my screen the enemy subs were shown as surfaced. When trying to force-attack them, the cursor disappeared.

Felt the same like ticking "disable shroud and fog" in the debug menu, except for the "staying surfaced" part.

Failed to reproduce it on a local game using multiple client instances.

data.title: Replace INotifyCreated with a priority queue & block upgrades until manager is notified
data.body:
This replaces INotifyCreated with a priority queue and gives UpgradeManager a much more immediate priority.

Should be what was requested in #8444.
Assuming TimedUpgradeBar is the problem, this fixes #8444.

data.title: Add a Demolish function to lua
data.body:
Split from #8418 as wished by @Mailaender (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8418#discussion_r33413516).

This functionality has already one :+1: from @obrakmann (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8418#issuecomment-114541500).

data.title: Make RequiresPower upgradable
data.body: While this could be used for Tesla boosting, it could have over uses such as adding an internal (backup) generator.

data.title: Fixed TS civilian structures and map decorations
data.body:
- fixed offsets for all civilian structures (closes #7744)
- fixed (or at least improved) offsets for rocks and trees
- CA00*\* structures are no longer exclusive to temperate theater and use the correct palette on snow maps as well
- same for CACRASH*\* crash sites
- removed some redundant junk from civilian structure sequences

data.title: Tiberian Sun infantry can't board APCs anymore
data.body: Reproducible on Hot Springs mpa. Might be a height related issue.

data.title: Added multiplier modifier traits, removing GainsStatUpgrades, InvulnerabilityUpgrade, & Invulnerable.
data.body:
A branch I created about 7 months ago and just rebased.

Adds:
- DamageMultiplier
- FirepowerMultiplier
- InaccuracyMultiplier
- ReloadDelayMultiplier
- SpeedMultiplier
- PowerMultiplier

Removes as redundant:
- Invulnerable
- GainsStatUpgrades
- InvulnerabilityUpgrade

This should remove GainsStatUpgrades bug(s) by simply replacing it.

(Hopefully this is the end of the PR madness.)

data.title: Actor 'camera (dead)' does not define a property 'Destroy'
data.body:
Probably another regression from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8226.

```
Fatal Lua Error: [string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: Actor 'camera (dead)' does not define a property 'Destroy'
   at OpenRA.Scripting.ScriptContext.FatalError(System.String message)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Scripting.TriggerGlobal+<OnAllRemovedFromWorld>c__AnonStorey3.<>m__0(OpenRA.Actor m)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Scripting.ScriptTriggers.RemovedFromWorld(OpenRA.Actor self)
   at OpenRA.World.Remove(OpenRA.Actor a)
   at OpenRA.Actor.<Dispose>m__6(OpenRA.World w)
   at OpenRA.World.Dispose()
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.Dispose()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(System.String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(System.String[] args)
```

data.title: Access violation when using SHP builder
data.body:
Hi all,

I was creating a unit with a custom sprite set (welll, a transport ship slapped on top of a cruiser) and tried the following:

Cmd prompt conversion- I got an unknown pixel format error. 

Shp compilation using Shp builder- imported my PNG file but shp builder sees it as one big sprite and refuses to see it any other way.

Constructing a Shp frame by frame- brute forcing copy posting eavh image frame by frame. This os where I run into access violations; it won't let me add any frames. I tried an older shp builder version but the current OpenRa version doesnt accept it.

I appreciate any help!
